selected_quotes: High Court says Australia legally responsible for offshore processing of #refugees, despite gov claims to contrary
A good analysis of yesterday's HC decision, with some small glimmers of hope
A surprisingly positive @madelinegleeson finding glimmers of hope for asylum seekers in latest High Court decision
High Ct: offshore #detention that exceeds what is reasonably necessary for processing is unlawful

citation.abstract: Parts of a High Court decision on the legality of offshore processing deal a crucial blow to the tired argument that what happens offshore is not Australia’s responsibility.

news.title: The high court, despite the law at its disposal, has let them get away with it | Richard Ackland
news.summary: The high court on Wednesday delivered a sad verdict to asylum seekers seeking to avoid transfer to the gulag of Nauru and those already there.

news.title: Kids Seeking Asylum Will Be Sent Back to Detention Facility, Despite Claims of Sexual Abuse

news.title: Churches would break the law if they gave sanctuary to asylum seekers – but does it matter?
news.summary: Churches around Australia invoked the centuries-old principle of church sanctuary following a High Court decision last week that cleared the way for 267 asylum seekers to be returned to Nauru or Manus Island.

news.title: Refugee-run school in Indonesia a model for governments to emulate
news.summary: A school set up by asylum seekers and refugees in the West Java town Cisarua, Indonesia, is an initiative that Australian and Indonesian governments should model and support.

news.title: High Court asked to declare Manus detention illegal as 859 detainees seek their day in court
news.summary: A writ of summons was registered in Australia’s High Court on Wednesday on behalf of 859 detainees at the Manus Island detention centre.

news.title: PNG court decision forces Australia to act on Manus Island detainees
news.summary: A five-judge panel of Papua New Guinea’s Supreme Court has held unanimously that the detention of asylum seekers at the Australian-built detention facility on Manus Island is unconstitutional and illegal under PNG law.

blogs.title: Kids Seeking Asylum Will Be Sent Back to Detention Facility, Despite Claims of Sexual Abuse
blogs.summary:
